original: BACKGROUND WHEREAS, VerticalNet owns and operates a series of Online Communities (as defined below) that are accessible via the World Wide Web, each of which is designed to be an online gathering place for businesses of a certain type or within a certain industry; and WHEREAS, LeadersOnline desires to advertise its job placement services (the "LeadersOnline Services") on certain of VerticalNet's Online Communities through banner ads, newsletters and employer spotlights, to access VerticalNet's proprietary resume bank and to display and maintain a Link (as defined below) from the LeadersOnline Site (as defined below) to a VerticalNet Site (as defined below) to enable users of the LeadersOnline Site to access and utilize the VerticalNet Online Communities; and WHEREAS, VerticalNet desires to permit LeadersOnline to advertise the LeadersOnline Services on certain of VerticalNet's Online Communities through banner ads, newsletters and employer spotlights, to allow LeadersOnline access to VerticalNet's proprietary resume bank and to create a Link from the LeadersOnline Site to a VerticalNet Site to enable users of the LeadersOnline Site to access and utilize the VerticalNet Online Communities.
ollama_generated:
BACKGROUND WHEREAS, VerticalNet manages a collection of Online Platforms (as defined below), each designed as an online hub for businesses within specific sectors or industries; and WHEREAS, LeadersOnline seeks to promote its job matching services (the "LeadersOnline Services") across some of VerticalNet's Online Platforms through banner advertisements, newsletters, and employer features, to obtain access to VerticalNet's exclusive resume database, and to establish a Hyperlink (as defined below) from the LeadersOnline Site (as defined below) to a VerticalNet Site (as defined below), facilitating users of the LeadersOnline Site in exploring and utilizing the VerticalNet Online Platforms; and WHEREAS, VerticalNet consents to grant LeadersOnline the privilege to advertise the LeadersOnline Services across some of VerticalNet's Online Platforms through banner advertisements, newsletters, and employer features, to extend access to LeadersOnline for VerticalNet's exclusive resume database, and to construct a Hyperlink from the LeadersOnline Site to a VerticalNet Site, providing users of the LeadersOnline Site with opportunities to engage with the VerticalNet Online Platforms.

In this rewritten clause, the responsibility for creating the link has been shifted to LeadersOnline and the obligation for VerticalNet to grant access to its proprietary resume bank has been changed into a privilege granted to LeadersOnline by VerticalNet.

original: 1.5.  Employer Spotlight shall mean a feature on the VeticialNet Sites containing company listings that  Link to full-page company descriptions of employers actively recruiting candidates to fill open positions within their companies that is framed by VerticalNet Proprietary Features.
ollama_generated: 1.5. The term "Employer Spotlight" refers to a distinctive section on the VeticialNet Platform, which highlights company listings connected to comprehensive, employer-provided descriptions, detailing open positions within their respective organizations. This area is defined and enriched by VerticalNet Proprietary Features. However, it's important to note that the ongoing responsibility for the accuracy and completeness of these employer-supplied descriptions lies with the employers themselves.

original: 1.13.  Link shall mean a link, including but not limited to a hyperlink, button or banner, that connects two Sites in a manner so that when a User clicks on the link, the User is transferred directly from one Site to a second Site.
modified: 1.13.  A Connection shall be defined as any means of navigation, such as but not limited to hyperlinks, buttons, or banners, that enable the transition of a User from one Website (referred to as the "first Site") to another (referred to as the "second Site"), without implying direct transfer. The User may access the second Site by initiating an action that results in the intended movement, but the first Site bears no responsibility for the User's navigation beyond this point.

original: 1.15.  Newsletter Ads shall mean an advertising message comprised of text describing LeadersOnline and its services that is placed in an email transmission containing employment related information supplied by VerticalNet that is transmitted to Users of the HR Site who have provided their email addresses to VerticalNet along with permission to transmit such messages to the email address.
ollama_generated: 1.15. The term "Newsletter Ads" refers to promotional content that embodies brief, descriptive text about LeadersOnline and its offerings. This content is strategically embedded within an electronic newsletter that encompasses employment-related information provided by VerticalNet. Such newsletters are distributed to the email addresses of users who have given their explicit consent to receive such promotional communications from VerticalNet, via the HR Site.

original: 1.18.  Site shall mean a site located on the World Wide Web portion of the Internet.
ollama_generated: 1.18. For the purposes hereof, "Site" refers to an online location within the expansive network known as the World Wide Web, which is accessible via the Internet.

original: 1.20.  Term shall mean the Effective Date through June 15, 2001 and any Renewal Term (as defined in paragraph 7.4 herein.) 1.21.  URL shall mean a universal resource locator used for the purpose of identifying a Site located on the Internet.
ollama_generated:
1.20. The Term, as referred to herein, encompasses the Effective Date up until June 15, 2001, and any subsequent Renewal Periods (as described in paragraph 7.4 herein). The continuation of this agreement beyond the initial term is contingent upon mutual consent between the parties.

1.21. A Site's location on the Internet shall be denoted by the URL, which stands for a specific resource identifier used for such purpose. It should be noted that the responsibility of maintaining and updating this identifier rests with the party assigned to manage the Site.

original: 4.2.  LeadersOnline Information.  Upon execution of this Agreement, LeadersOnline shall supply VerticalNet with a graphical image in electronic form of its LeadersOnline Mark, a text file containing information describing LeadersOnline and the URL to which the hypertext Link shall be directed.
ollama_generated: 4.2.  Provision of LeadersOnline Information. Upon the execution of this Agreement, VerticalNet will receive from LeadersOnline an electronic form of their LeadersOnline Mark in a graphical image and a text file containing details about LeadersOnline, including the URL to which the hypertext Link may be directed. The responsibility for ensuring the accuracy and currency of such information lies with LeadersOnline. Any errors or inconsistencies in this data shall not constitute a breach of this Agreement by VerticalNet unless specifically agreed otherwise in writing.

original: 5.2.  Restrictions.  Any information concerning a Candidate contained in a resume included in the Resume Bank shall not be provided to any third party by LeadersOnline, including corporate Affiliates of LeadersOnline, without the written consent of the individual whose information would be disclosed.
modified: 5.2. Disclosure of Information. While we strive to maintain confidentiality, it's important to note that information regarding a Candidate, as provided in the Resume Bank, may occasionally be shared with third parties, including affiliates of LeadersOnline, without obtaining prior written consent from the individual whose data is being disclosed. However, our policy is to make such disclosures only when strictly necessary and in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.

original: LeadersOnline shall limit contact with a Candidate to either one phone contact or one e-mail contact per calendar quarter, unless expressly agreed to by the Candidate.  LeadersOnline shall immediately cease all contact upon the request of the Candidate.  All information concerning a Candidate, whether in paper or electronic form, and whether originally contained in the Resume Bank or derived from information contained in the Resume Bank, shall be immediately returned to VerticalNet upon the termination of this Agreement.  All information contained in the Resume Bank shall be handled by LeadersOnline in accordance with VerticalNet's standard Privacy Policy as it may be posted on the VerticalNet Sites from time to time.  The foregoing restrictions shall cease to apply from and after the time that a Candidate registers through an online form or takes other affirmative action to become a member of the LeadersOnline "Candidate Community." 6.   THE COMMERCIAL TERMS 6.1.  Fees. As set forth in Section 6.2   [Payment of Fees] , LeadersOnline shall pay to VerticalNet the following:
modified:
6. Communications and Data Usage:

6.1. Contact Limitations: LeadersOnline may initiate up to one phone contact or e-mail contact per calendar quarter with a Candidate, at its discretion, without requiring express consent from the Candidate. However, LeadersOnline shall promptly discontinue all contact upon the request of the Candidate, regardless of any previous communication.

6.2. Data Retention and Return: All information about a Candidate, in both physical and digital formats, whether sourced from the Resume Bank or derived therefrom, will be held by LeadersOnline. Upon termination of this Agreement, LeadersOnline shall promptly return all Candidate data to VerticalNet, unless required by law or court order to retain such information.

6.3. Data Handling and Privacy: All Candidate information handled by LeadersOnline will be in accordance with the latest version of VerticalNet's Privacy Policy, as publicly available on VerticalNet Sites.

6.4. Waiver of Restrictions: The aforementioned limitations on contact and data usage shall only apply until a Candidate actively registers through an online form or takes other affirmative actions to join the LeadersOnline "Candidate Community."

6.5. Commercial Terms:

6.1.1. Fees and Payments: As detailed in Section 6.2.2 [Payment Schedule], VerticalNet shall receive payments from LeadersOnline according to the agreed-upon schedule and terms.

original: 6.4.  Taxes.  All payments required under this Agreement are exclusive of federal, state, local and foreign taxes, duties, tariffs, levies and similar assessments.  When applicable, such taxes shall appear as separate items on a Party's invoice or statement to the other Party.  Payment of such taxes or charges shall be the responsibility of the Party whose obligation it is under this Agreement to make the payment in respect of which such taxes are assessed, excluding any taxes based upon the other Party's net income.  In lieu thereof, a Party shall provide the other Party with a tax or levy exemption certificate acceptable to the taxing or levying authority.
modified:
6.4. Taxes and Other Charges: All payments made under this Agreement are not inclusive of any federal, state, local, or foreign taxes, duties, tariffs, levies, and similar assessments. Any such charges will be itemized separately on a Party's invoice or statement sent to the other Party. The recipient Party shall bear the responsibility for these taxes, except for those based on the provider Party's net income. To mitigate this obligation, the provider Party may present the recipient Party with a tax exemption certificate that is acceptable to the relevant taxing or levying authority.

This version of the clause shifts the responsibility for taxes (except for taxes based on the provider party's net income) from the paying party to the receiving party. Additionally, it clarifies that tax exemption certificates will be provided by the provider party, as opposed to the recipient party in the original clause.

original: 7.   TERMINATION AND RENEWAL.
ollama_generated:
7. TERMINATION AND CONTINUATION OPTIONS.

In the event Party A decides to terminate this agreement, it shall provide a written notice sixty (60) days prior to such termination, unless otherwise required by law. In case of non-termination by either party, this agreement shall automatically renew for successive one-year terms, with the option for either party to give written notice thirty (30) days before the end of each term if they wish to terminate or renegotiate the terms. Party B shall not be held responsible for any losses or liabilities incurred by Party A during the period between the receipt of such notice and the actual termination date, unless explicitly agreed otherwise in writing.

original: Source: LEADERSONLINE INC, S-1/A, 4/27/2000 7.2.  Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, (i) LeadersOnline shall no longer have the right to use any VerticalNet Mark, (ii) VerticalNet shall no longer have the right to use any LeadersOnline Mark; (iii) all Links between the VerticalNet Sites and the LeadersOnline Site shall be removed; (iv) VerticalNet shall remove all LeadersOnline Employer Spotlights from its Sites; (v) VerticalNet shall cease displaying or transmitting all Banners and Newsletter Ads of LeadersOnline; and (vi) LeadersOnline shall return all information concerning Candidates in accordance with Section 5.2 of this Agreement.
modified:
Clause:
Source: REVISED LEADERSONLINE INC, Amended S-1/B, 5/12/2002
6.3. Upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, (i) VerticalNet shall retain the right to use any LeadersOnline Mark for a period of sixty days following such termination or expiration for promotional purposes, (ii) LeadersOnline shall retain the right to use any VerticalNet Mark for a period of thirty days following such termination or expiration for similar purposes, (iii) all Links between the LeadersOnline Site and the VerticalNet Sites shall remain intact during this transition period, (iv) LeadersOnline shall allow VerticalNet to maintain LeadersOnline Employer Spotlights on its Sites during this transition period, (v) VerticalNet shall continue to display or transmit all Banners and Newsletter Ads of LeadersOnline during this transition period, and (vi) VerticalNet may elect not to return all information concerning Candidates, provided it complies with applicable data protection laws.

original: 7.3.  Following expiration or termination of this Agreement, the terms and provisions of Section 6 above shall continue to govern LeadersOnline's payment obligations.  Following termination, LeadersOnline shall provide VerticalNet with a final accounting with respect to this Agreement and tender payment of amounts due under Section 6 at the next scheduled payment date. LeadersOnline shall be obligated to pay VerticalNet the fees set forth in Section 6.3.2   [Revenue Sharing]  for any Placement that occurs within six (6) months following termination of this Agreement.
modified: 7.3. Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, VerticalNet shall assume responsibility for managing payment obligations related to Section 6. Within a reasonable time after termination, LeadersOnline will provide VerticalNet with a final accounting regarding this Agreement and remit any outstanding payments due under Section 6 at the earliest possible payment date following termination. LeadersOnline's obligation to make payments to VerticalNet under the Revenue Sharing clause (Section 6.3.2) for any Placement made within six (6) months post-termination shall cease.

original: 8.2.  Arbitration.  Any controversy or claim between the Parties concerning any breach or alleged breach of this Agreement or performance or nonperformance of any obligation under this Agreement or otherwise with respect to this Agreement which cannot be resolved by negotiation will be resolved by binding arbitration under this Section 8.2   [Arbitration]  and the then-current Commercial Rules and supervision of the American Arbitration Association (the "AAA"). If any part of this Section 8.2   [Arbitration]  is held to be unenforceable, it will be severed and will not affect either the duty to arbitrate or any other part of this Section 8.2   [Arbitration] .  The arbitration will be held in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, before a sole disinterested arbitrator who is knowledgeable in business information and the Internet and experienced in handling commercial disputes.  The arbitrator shall be appointed jointly by the Parties hereto within 30 days following the date on which the arbitration is instituted.  If the Parties are unable to agree upon the arbitrator within such 30-day period, the AAA shall be instructed to select such arbitrator within 15 days thereafter.  The arbitrator's award will be final and binding and may be entered in any court having jurisdiction.  The arbitrator will not have the power to award punitive or exemplary damages, or any damages excluded by, or in excess of, any damage limitations expressed in this Agreement.  Issues of arbitrability will be determined in accordance solely with the federal substantive and procedural laws relating to arbitration; in all other respects, the arbitrator will be obligated to apply and follow the substantive law of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.
modified:
8.2. Mediation Process: In the event that any dispute or disagreement arises between the Parties regarding this Agreement, its interpretation, execution, or alleged breach, and such matter cannot be resolved amicably through discussions, it shall first be subject to mediation. This mediation process will abide by the then-current Mediation Rules of the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) and overseen by an impartial mediator with expertise in business information and Internet affairs, as well as experience in handling commercial disputes.

If any component of this Section 8.2 [Mediation Process] is deemed unenforceable, it shall be severed without affecting the remaining provisions or the obligation to engage in mediation. The mediator will be appointed by the Parties jointly within thirty (30) days following the initiation of the mediation process. If agreement on the mediator cannot be reached within this timeframe, the ICC shall appoint the mediator within fifteen (15) days thereafter.

The decision rendered by the mediator will serve as a non-binding recommendation for resolution. The Parties may accept or reject the recommendation at their discretion. In the event that the recommendation is rejected, either Party may then proceed to arbitration under Section 8.2 [Arbitration] herein. The mediator shall have no authority to award punitive or exemplary damages, or any damages exceeding the damage limitations set forth in this Agreement. Matters of mediation's jurisdiction will be determined in accordance with the federal substantive and procedural laws relating to mediation; in all other respects, the mediator will be bound by and adhere to the substantive law of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

original: Source: LEADERSONLINE INC, S-1/A, 4/27/2000 9.   CONFIDENTIALITY 9.1.  Confidentiality Obligations.  Except as permitted elsewhere under this Agreement, each Party agrees to take Reasonable Steps (as defined below) (a) to receive and maintain the Confidential Information of the other Party in confidence and (b) not to disclose such Confidential Information to any third parties, provided, the receiving Party may disclose such Confidential Information to its employees, representatives and agents who have a need to know such information for purposes of carrying out the terms of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

Revised: LEADERSONLINE INC, S-1/A, 4/27/2000
8. DISCLOSURE OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION
8.1. Permission for Disclosure. Each Party is granted the discretion to disclose the Confidential Information of the other Party to third parties under the following conditions: (a) the disclosing Party deems it necessary, and (b) the recipient agrees, in writing, to maintain the confidentiality of the shared information and abide by all relevant terms of this Agreement. However, it is understood that each Party may disclose Confidential Information to its employees, representatives, and agents who have a need to know such information for purposes of carrying out the terms of this Agreement without seeking explicit permission.

Explanation: The revised clause shifts the responsibility from the receiving party to maintain confidentiality to the disclosing party. It also removes the condition that the disclosure must be reasonable and allows the disclosing party to use its discretion in deciding whether or not to share the Confidential Information with third parties. Lastly, it clarifies that employees, representatives, and agents of either party may access the Confidential Information without needing explicit permission from the other party.

original: 11. DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTY, LIMITATION OF LIABILITY AND INDEMNIFICATION.
ollama_generated:
11. IMPLIED WARRANTIES RESTRICTION, MODIFIED LIABILITY CAP AND INDEMNIFICATION PROVISIONS.

In this Agreement, we acknowledge that the Services provided hereunder are offered on an "as-is" and "as available" basis without any express or implied warranties of any kind, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, non-infringement, accuracy, system integration or performance.

We shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential or exemplary damages arising out of the use or inability to use the Services, including but not limited to lost profits, loss of goodwill, service interruptions, device damage or system failure. Our total liability under this Agreement shall be limited to the amount paid by You for the Services during the preceding twelve (12) months.

However, each Party agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the other Party from any claims, damages, liabilities, costs or expenses arising out of such Party's breach of this Agreement, negligence, willful misconduct or violation of any applicable laws. This provision shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement.

In this revised clause, the implied warranties are restricted and our liability for damages is capped at the amount paid by the client during the preceding twelve months. Additionally, both parties agree to indemnify each other for claims arising out of their breach of the agreement, negligence, willful misconduct or violation of applicable laws.

original: LEADERSONLINE EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES AS TO THE USER INTERFACE OR USER EXPERIENCE ASSOCIATED WITH THE LEADERSONLINE SITE AND RESERVES THE RIGHT, IN ITS SOLE DISCRETION, TO MODIFY THE PLACEMENT OF ALL LINKS, URLS AND PROPRIETARY FEATURES; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT IN THE EVENT LEADERSONLINE REDESIGNS THE USER INTERFACE, SUCH LINKS, URLS AND PROPRIETARY FEATURES SHALL RECEIVE PLACEMENT SUBSTANTIALLY SIMILAR TO THE ORIGINAL DESIGN.
ollama_generated: LEADERSONLINE specifically disclaims any and all warranties concerning the User Interface or User Experience offered on the LEADERSONLINE Site, retaining the prerogative, at its sole discretion, to rearrange the positions of all links, URLs, and proprietary features. Notwithstanding, in the event that LEADERSONLINE decides to revamp the User Interface, these specific links, URLs, and proprietary features will be placed with a reasonable degree of similarity to their original design.

original: 12.7.  Notices.  All notices, reports, payments and other communications required or permitted to be given under this Agreement (each, a "Notice") shall be in writing and shall be given either by personal delivery against a signed receipt, by express delivery using a nationally recognized overnight courier, or by facsimile. All Notices shall be properly addressed as follows, or to such other addresses as may be specified in a Notice given hereunder:
ollama_generated:
12.7. Communication Obligations: All written communications, notifications, reports, payments, and other documents necessary or permitted under this Agreement (hereinafter referred to as "Communications") shall be made either by personal delivery with an electronic acknowledgment, through a reputable email service with read receipt, or by registered post. All Communications shall be directed to the parties' most recent contact information, as updated from time to time, or as explicitly specified in subsequent Communications:

This revised clause slightly modifies the original by allowing for electronic communication methods such as email and read receipts, which may be more convenient in today's digital age. It also introduces the concept of a "read receipt" in email communications, ensuring that both parties can confirm delivery and review of the message. Furthermore, it allows for Communications to be addressed to updated contact information, fostering flexibility in the event of changes in party contacts.

original: 12.8.  Amendment or Modification.  No subsequent amendment, modification or waiver of any of the provisions of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by the Parties.
ollama_generated: 12.8. Amendment or Modification: Any informal attempts to modify, amend, or waive any provisions of this Agreement are invalid and unenforceable, unless they are made in writing and affirmed by all parties in writing.

original: 12.14.  Waiver of Jury Trial.  Each Party hereby irrevocably waives all rights a Party may have to a trial by jury in any legal action or proceeding arising out of or in connection with this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby.
ollama_generated: 12.14. Right to Jury Trial Waived. Each Party acknowledges and irrevocably waives any right they may have, now or in the future, to demand a trial by jury in any dispute or legal action stemming from this Agreement or related transactions. Instead, each Party agrees that all disputes shall be resolved through binding arbitration or mutual negotiation, with the sole exception of claims seeking injunctive relief or requests for small claims court proceedings, which may proceed before a judge or jury as applicable.

original: 12.16.  Force Majeure.  Neither Party shall be held to be in breach of this Agreement by reason of a force majeure event, including, but not limited to, act of God, delay in transportation, fire, flood, earthquake, storm, war, act of a public enemy, civil commotion or any law, rule, regulation, order or other action by any public authority or any other matter reasonably beyond a Party's control. To the extent failure to perform is caused by such a force majeure event, such Party shall be excused from performance hereunder so long as such event continues to prevent such performance, and provided the non-performing Party takes all reasonable steps to resume full performance, provided further that if such delay in performance exceeds 60 days, the other Party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to the non-performing Party.
ollama_generated:
12.16. Unforeseen Circumstances. Each Party shall be released from any liability for breach of this Agreement due to unforeseen circumstances, such as but not limited to, acts of God, transportation delays, fires, floods, earthquakes, storms, war, hostile actions by a public or private entity, social unrest, or any other events that a Party deems beyond its reasonable control. In the event that such circumstances render performance impossible, the affected Party shall be relieved from its obligations under this Agreement until the obstruction ceases; however, it shall take all reasonable measures to resume full compliance with this Agreement as soon as practicable. If the non-compliance persists for more than 60 days, the other Party retains the right to terminate this Agreement upon delivering written notice to the non-compliant Party.

This revised clause aims to lessen the obligation on a party in case of unforeseen circumstances and makes it clearer that the affected party should take reasonable steps to resume compliance as soon as possible. It also clarifies that termination can occur only if non-compliance persists for more than 60 days, rather than stating that it may be terminated after 60 days.
